humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that one out of 13 assessed lymph nodes is positive for metastatic adenocarcinoma (part 2). This corresponds to the N1 stage based on the new rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (No/Total). The report also mentions that three lymph nodes from the right axillary and three lymph nodes from the right internal mammary are free of tumor (parts 3, 4, and 6). These details support the N1 stage prediction.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic adenocarcinoma involving one lymph node (1/1) in the right axillary sentinel node biopsy (part 2). This indicates a pathologic N1 stage. The other lymph node groups are free of tumor (parts 3, 4, and 6). The substaging information, such as the extracapsular extension, is not considered in this case.
